title: Catherine Zeta-Jones and Michael Douglas Buy and Sell in the New York Suburbs
text:
Hollywood power couple Catherine Zeta-Jones and Michael Douglas have made some adjustments to their New York real estate portfolio with the purchase of one mansion and the sale of another.



The duo paid $4.5 million for a riverfront property in Irvington, New York—an affluent spot in Westchester County—in a deal that hit property records on Aug. 23.



More: Betsey Johnson Lists Paradise Cove Mobile Home for $1.95 Million

A limited liability company linked to the pair was used for the purchase, records show.



The 1930s Georgian manor house is “majestically positioned at the end of a wooded drive on 12 rolling acres,” according to the listing with Houlihan Lawrence. A representative from the brokerage did not immediately respond to a request for comment.



Spanning 11,653 square feet, the house has eight bedrooms, including a master suite with a drawing room and dressing room, a living room with a French limestone fireplace, a two-story paneled library and a stone terrace overlooking the Hudson River.



There’s also an indoor pool, a gym, a recreation room and a summer kitchen.



And if those features aren’t enough, there’s potential to add outdoor amenities including a pool, tennis court, cabana and guest cottage, the listing said.



A few weeks before the buy, the couple sold a home in posh Bedford Corners, New York—about 20 miles north of their new acquisition—for $20.47 million, in a seemingly off-market deal.



Ms. Zeta-Jones, 49, and Mr. Douglas, 74, paid $11.25 million for the almost 15,500- square-foot mansion in 2014, property records show. They used the same LLC for both transactions.

Built in 1895 and totally renovated, the eight-bedroom home has two indoor pools, an outdoor pool, a gym, a sauna and steam room, a tennis court, a guest cottage with two apartments, and equestrian facilities, according to limited listing information available online.



A representative for Ms. Zeta-Jones, who is best known for her roles in “Chicago” and “Entrapment,” did not immediately respond to a request for comment.



A representative for Mr. Douglas, who most recently starred in Marvel's “Avengers: Endgame” and “Ant-Man and the Wasp,” declined to comment on the deal.



The couple’s real estate dealings are not confined to New York, or even the U.S. They are currently looking for a buyer for their 200-plus acre €29 million (US$31.9 million) estate in Mallorca, one of Spain’s Balearic Islands.



Architectural Digest first reported the sale.
